info.title: Family budget API
info.description: API for calculation and planning of expenses and family expenses

tags.name: auth-controller
tags.description: Controller for registration and activation users and for authentication

get.description: This code is an endpoint for retrieving accounts by user email. It takes in several parameters, including an authorization token, the user's email, a starting index (from) for pagination, and a maximum (size) number of results to return.

put.description:
Updates an existing account for the user with the specified email.

The email should be provided as a request parameter and the updated account details should be provided in the request body.

If the email provided in the request parameter does not match the email in the JWT token, a ForbiddenException will be thrown.

Returns the updated account.

post.description:
Creates a new account for the user with the specified email.

The email should be provided as a request parameter and the account details should be provided in the request body.

If the email provided in the request parameter does not match the email in the JWT token, a ForbiddenException will be thrown.

Returns the created account.

delete.description:
Deletes an existing account for the user with the specified email.

The email should be provided as a request parameter and the account ID should be provided as a path variable.

If the email provided in the request parameter does not match the email in the JWT token, a ForbiddenException will be thrown.

Returns a ResponseEntity with a status code of 200 OK.

get.description: Returns a result about the activation status

schema.title: ResponseUserSecurityStatus
schema.description: Response to security operations with a user

post.description: Returns the token success lock result

schema.title: ResponseUserSecurityStatus
schema.description: Response to security operations with a user

post.description: The username and password are sent in json format. The body of the request is the AuthenticationRequest class. If the name and password match the entry in the database, then a token is generated and sent in json format. The body of the response is the AuthenticationResponse class. Else an appropriate exception will be thrown.

put.description: Third step of password recovery. Input new password

schema.title: ResponseUserSecurityStatus
schema.description: Response to security operations with a user

post.description: The email, firstName, lastName, currency, password and confirmPassword are sent in json format. The body of the request is the RegistrationRequest class. Add new user with password to database. The body of the response is the UserDto class (it contains id, email, firstName, lastName and currency). If a user with the same email already exists or password has not correct format or password and confirmPassword don't match or currency has incorrect name, an appropriate exception will be thrown
First step of password recovery. Send link to email

get.description: Second step of password recovery. Follow to link

schema.title: ResponseUserSecurityStatus
schema.description: Response to security operations with a user

get.summary: Get expense categories by user email
get.description: This code is an endpoint for retrieving income categories by user email. It takes in several parameters, including an authorization token, the user's email, a starting index (from) for pagination, and a maximum (size) number of results to return.

put.description:
Updates an existing expense category for the user with the specified email.

The email should be provided as a request parameter and the updated category details should be provided in the request body.

If the email provided in the request parameter does not match the email in the JWT token, a ForbiddenException will be thrown.

Returns the updated category.

post.description:
Creates a new expense category for the user with the specified email.

The email should be provided as a request parameter and the category details should be provided in the request body.

If the email provided in the request parameter does not match the email in the JWT token, a ForbiddenException will be thrown.

Returns the created category.

delete.description:
Deletes an existing expense category for the user with the specified email.

The email should be provided as a request parameter and the category ID should be provided as a path variable.

If the email provided in the request parameter does not match the email in the JWT token, a ForbiddenException will be thrown.

Returns a ResponseEntity with a status code of 200 OK.
